results.title: A Gut Feeling: Isolated Small Bowel Angioedema due to Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme Inhibitor.
results.text_hl: Here, we present a case of @DISEASE_Angioedema @DISEASE_MESH:D000799 @@@visceral angioedema@@@ in a 32-year-old @SPECIES_9606 @@@woman@@@ who presented with @DISEASE_Pain @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@left upper quadrant pain@@@, @DISEASE_Nausea @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@, @DISEASE_Vomiting @DISEASE_MESH:D014839 @@@vomiting@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Diarrhea</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhea@@@, and characteristic radiographic signs of small @DISEASE_Edema @DISEASE_MESH:D004487 @@@bowel angio-edema@@@, six months after starting @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@.

citations.NLM: Pinto MB, Vecchio M, Santos MA. A Gut Feeling: Isolated Small Bowel Angioedema due to Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme Inhibitor. R I Med J (2013). 2022 Aug 1;105(6):28-31. PMID: 35881996
citations.BibTeX: @article{35881996, title={A Gut Feeling: Isolated Small Bowel Angioedema due to Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme Inhibitor.}, author={Pinto MB and Vecchio M and Santos MA}, journal={R I Med J (2013)}, volume={105}, number={6}, pages={28-31}}

results.title: Clinical experience with lisinopril. Observations on safety and tolerability.
results.text_hl: In the @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ population, the most frequent adverse events reported were @DISEASE_Headache @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@, @DISEASE_Dizziness @DISEASE_MESH:D004244 @@@dizziness@@@, @DISEASE_Cough @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@cough@@@, @DISEASE_Nausea @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Diarrhea</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhoea@@@ and @DISEASE_Fatigue @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@fatigue@@@, although not all of these events were thought to be related to @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@; 6.1% discontinued @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ due to adverse clinical events, most commonly @DISEASE_Cough @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@cough@@@ and @DISEASE_Nausea @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@.

citations.NLM: Cameron HA, Higgins TJ. Clinical experience with lisinopril. Observations on safety and tolerability. J Hum Hypertens. 1989 Jun;3 Suppl 1():177-86. PMID: 2550641
citations.BibTeX: @article{2550641, title={Clinical experience with lisinopril. Observations on safety and tolerability.}, author={Cameron HA and Higgins TJ}, journal={J Hum Hypertens}, volume={3 Suppl 1}, pages={177-86}}

results.title: The safety and tolerability of lisinopril in clinical trials.
results.text_hl: In the @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ population, the most frequent clinical adverse experiences on @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ alone were @DISEASE_Headache @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@, @DISEASE_Dizziness @DISEASE_MESH:D004244 @@@dizziness@@@, @DISEASE_Cough @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@cough@@@, and @<m>DISEASE_Diarrhea</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhea@@@.

citations.NLM: Rush JE, Merrill DD. The safety and tolerability of lisinopril in clinical trials. J Cardiovasc Pharmacol. 1987;9 Suppl 3():S99-107. PMID: 2442561
citations.BibTeX: @article{2442561, title={The safety and tolerability of lisinopril in clinical trials.}, author={Rush JE and Merrill DD}, journal={J Cardiovasc Pharmacol}, volume={9 Suppl 3}, pages={S99-107}}

results.title: Review of international safety data for lisinopril-hydrochlorothiazide combination treatment.
results.text_hl: In clinical trials, adverse experiences in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ treated with a @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@-@CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@hydrochlorothiazide@@@ combination were @DISEASE_Dizziness @DISEASE_MESH:D004244 @@@dizziness@@@ (7.5%), @DISEASE_Headache @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@ (5.2%), @DISEASE_Cough @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@cough@@@ (3.9%), @DISEASE_Fatigue @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@fatigue@@@ (3.7%), @DISEASE_Headache @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@orthostatic effects@@@ (3.2%), @<m>DISEASE_Diarrhea</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhoea@@@ (2.5%), @DISEASE_Nausea @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@ (2.2%) and @DISEASE_Respiratory_Tract_Infections @DISEASE_MESH:D012141 @@@upper respiratory tract infection@@@ (2.2%).

citations.NLM: Murray NH. Review of international safety data for lisinopril-hydrochlorothiazide combination treatment. J Hum Hypertens. 1991 Dec;5 Suppl 2():63-7; discussion 68. PMID: 1665180
citations.BibTeX: @article{1665180, title={Review of international safety data for lisinopril-hydrochlorothiazide combination treatment.}, author={Murray NH}, journal={J Hum Hypertens}, volume={5 Suppl 2}, pages={63-7; discussion 68}}

results.title: Lisinopril: a review of its use in congestive heart failure.
results.text_hl: In controlled clinical trials, the most common adverse events occurring in recipients of the drug were @DISEASE_Dizziness @DISEASE_MESH:D004244 @@@dizziness@@@, @DISEASE_Headache @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@, @DISEASE_Hypotension @DISEASE_MESH:D007022 @@@hypotension@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Diarrhea</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhoea@@@. Overall adverse event profiles for @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ treated with high or low doses of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ in the ATLAS study were similar.

citations.NLM: Simpson K, Jarvis B. Lisinopril: a review of its use in congestive heart failure. Drugs. 2000 May;59(5):1149-67. PMID: 10852646
citations.BibTeX: @article{10852646, title={Lisinopril: a review of its use in congestive heart failure.}, author={Simpson K and Jarvis B}, journal={Drugs}, volume={59}, number={5}, pages={1149-67}}

results.title: Recognizing a Rare Phenomenon of Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme Inhibitors: Visceral Angioedema Presenting with Chronic Diarrhea-A Case Report.
results.text_hl: After an exhaustive laboratory work-up, her @<m>DISEASE_Diarrhea</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhea@@@ resolved only after the discontinuation of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@.

citations.NLM: Gabriel JG, Vedantam V, Kapila A, Bajaj K. Recognizing a Rare Phenomenon of Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme Inhibitors: Visceral Angioedema Presenting with Chronic Diarrhea-A Case Report. Perm J. 2018;22():17-030. PMID: 29236651
citations.BibTeX: @article{29236651, title={Recognizing a Rare Phenomenon of Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme Inhibitors: Visceral Angioedema Presenting with Chronic Diarrhea-A Case Report.}, author={Gabriel JG and Vedantam V and Kapila A and Bajaj K}, journal={Perm J}, volume={22}, pages={17-030}}

results.title: Colonic ulcers accompanying collagenous colitis: implication of nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs.
results.text_hl: Of the two @DISEASE_Colitis_Collagenous @DISEASE_MESH:D046729 @@@CC-U@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ who did not use NSAIDs, one @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ was taking @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ (angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor), and the @<m>DISEASE_Diarrhea</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhea@@@ resolved after stopping the drug; the @DISEASE_Ulcer @DISEASE_MESH:D014456 @@@ulceration@@@ in the second @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ was thought to be @DISEASE_Brain_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D002545 @@@ischemic@@@ in origin.

citations.NLM: Kakar S, Pardi DS, Burgart LJ. Colonic ulcers accompanying collagenous colitis: implication of nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs. Am J Gastroenterol. 2003 Aug;98(8):1834-7. PMID: 12907340
citations.BibTeX: @article{12907340, title={Colonic ulcers accompanying collagenous colitis: implication of nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs.}, author={Kakar S and Pardi DS and Burgart LJ}, journal={Am J Gastroenterol}, volume={98}, number={8}, pages={1834-7}}
